description:
But we start in the US where a man has been arrested and charged for plotting an attack on the US Capitol building. Our North America editor Jon Sopel spoke to me from Washington.

"We've just got the court documents from the Ohio district court, and it cites an attempted killing of a US government officer and the possession of a firearm in furtherance of an attempted crime of violence. That's on the front cover of the court. It seems that the FBI had been monitoring Christopher Cornell for a little while. He was also known on Twitter as 'Raheel Mahrus Ubaydah' and had wanted to forge an alliance with Islamic State. It seems that he had been researching how to make pipe bombs and how to source a semi-automatic weapon and how much it would cost. They had been watching him. When he went to buy the weapon, which he did allegedly today an ArmaLite semi-automatic plus 600 rounds of ammunition with a plan to travel to Washington DC and kill employees, and officers working in and around the US Capitol. When I say that I'm reading from the court documents, it was then that the Joint Terrorism Task Force decided that they would move in and they have arrested Cornell and he is now in custody."
